description: Ms. codex. Title from note on fol. 1a. Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in black ink. Light cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Marginal annotations. Inscription "14" and "numrah 14" in Arabic script on the pastedown of upper cover and fol. 1a. Collation: Paper, fol. 267 ; 1¹⁰ (-2 at beginning of quire) 2-26¹⁰ 27¹⁰ (-1 at end of quire) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Origin: Copy completed in Rajab 811 [Nov.-Dec. 1408] by Kamāl Ibn ʻUbayd Allāh al-Qūmānī (colophon, fol. 265a). Incipit: الحمد لله الذي تجلى على بعض عباده المخلصين المخلّصين عن شرك الشرك الخفى باسمه الواسع العليم وحلى ظواهرهم وبواطنهم بالتجليات العرفانية القرانية ... [2أ] ... وبعد فيقول العبد ... ابو محمد منصور ابن احمد ابن مويد الخوارزمى القاآنى كما كان المومنون اخوة والاخوة يقتضى الشفقة والايثار ... [3أ] ... باب الامر قدم الشيخ رحمه الله باب الامر والنهى على ساير الابواب Explicit: جعلهما مجازا عنها اولى من جعلهما مجازا عن غيرها والله اعلم بالصواب
author: Ibn Qāʼānī, Manṣūr ibn Aḥmad, d. 1373 or 4.
abstract: Commentary on al-Mughnī fī uṣūl al-fiqh by al-Khabbāzī (d. 691/1292).
extent: 267 leaves : paper ; 250 x 165 (165 x 105) mm. bound to 250 x 180 mm.
provenance: Ownership statement in the name of al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ḥasabī Zade on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Ibn Qāʼānī, Manṣūr ibn Aḥmad, d. 1373 or 4.
ابن قاءاني، منصور بن احمد
subject: Khabbāzī, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad, 1231 or 1232-1292—Mughnī fī uṣūl al-fiqh—Commentaries—14th century
binding_note: Marbled paper over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Brown leather spine and edges. Traces of a now wanting fore-edge flap. paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
